abstract: Mylan Laboratories has agreed to buy the generic drug unit of Merck, the German drug maker, for 4.9 billion euros ($6.7 billion) in cash. The acquisition will make Mylan the world’s third-largest maker of copycat versions of drugs, after Teva Pharmaceuticals of Israel and Novartis of Switzerland.
lead_paragraph: Mylan Laboratories has agreed to buy the generic drug unit of Merck, the German drug maker, for 4.9 billion euros ($6.7 billion) in cash. The acquisition will make Mylan the world’s third-largest maker of copycat versions of drugs, after Teva Pharmaceuticals of Israel and Novartis of Switzerland.

headline.main: Mylan Labs in Deal to Buy German Generic Drug Unit
